text: But propionate is also involved in gluconeogenesis, which diverts fatty acids away from cholesterol synthesis and toward glucose synthesis.
It also stimulates the production of gut hormones that limit hunger, both of which are anti-obesity effects.
It is used primarily by intestinal epithelial cells for energy and stimulates production of gut hormones that limit hunger.

Acetate is absorbed well by intestinal epithelial cells, travels to the liver where it is used for lipid synthesis, and is distributed throughout the body to be used as a substrate for cholesterol synthesis (particularly in adipose tissues).
